(AP Photo/Eric Risberg) ORG XMIT: CAER105 Brendan Steele follows his shot from the second tee of the Silverado Resort North Course during the second round of the Frys.com PGA Tour golf tournament Friday, Oct. 16, 2015, in Napa, Calif. (AP Photo/Eric ... more Photo: Eric Risberg Noteworthy 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Report: Germany paid bribes to host '06 Cup
BERLIN — A German newspaper is reporting that Germany's bid to host the World Cup in 2006 was aided by bribes paid to FIFA executive committee members.
The weekly paper Der Spiegel says on its website that "the awarding of the 2006 World Cup to Germany was allegedly bought" with a slush fund set up by the German bid committee of 10.3 million Swiss francs contributed by former Adidas chief Robert Louis-Dreyfus .
Der Spiegel says Louis-Dreyfus loaned the money as a private citizen to the bid committee before the awarding of the tourney on July 6, 2000. It was reportedly used to secure the votes of four Asian representatives on FIFA 's 24-member executive committee.
Golf: Brendan Steele has a two-shot lead after the second round of the Frys.com Open. ... Lydia Ko made an 18-foot birdie putt on the final hole for a 7-under 65 and a one-stroke lead in the LPGA KEB Hana Bank Championship. ... Wes Short Jr. birdied three of the last four holes for a 5-under 67 and a one-stroke lead in the Champions Tour's San Antonio Championship. ... Andy Sullivan had a 7-under 64 for a second straight day for a three-shot lead at the Portugal Masters.
Tennis: Rafael Nadal beat a top-five player for the first time in more than a year by defeating Stan Wawrinka 6-2, 6-1 to reach the semifinals of the Shanghai Masters. Nadal will play Jo-Wilfried Tsonga on Saturday after the French player topped Kevin Anderson 7-6 (6), 5-7, 6-4. Top-seeded Novak Djokovic also advanced with his 15th consecutive victory, holding off Australia's Bernard Tomic in a tight first-set tiebreaker before closing it out 7-6 (6), 6-1. Djokovic will play Andy Murray , who beat Tomas Berdych 6-1, 6-3. ... Venus Williams closed in on a spot in the season-ending WTA Finals by beating Alize Cornet 6-1, 6-1 to reach the Hong Kong Open semifinals. Williams will next meet Jelena Jankovic , who beat Daria Gavrilova 6-1, 6-1. Angelique Kerber and Samantha Stosur also advanced.
— Wire reports
